str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To hope before, be the first to hope. From pro and elpizo; to hope in advance of other confirmation.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Commendation, praise, approval. From epi and the base of aineo; laudation; concretely, a commendable thing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
